"Singers to the front!" came the captain's or- der. 
And from the different ranks some twenty men ran to the front. A drummer, their leader, turned round facing the singers, and flourishing his arm, began a long-drawn-out soldiers' song, commencing with the words: "Morning dawned, the sun was rising" arid concluding: "On then, brothers, on to glory, led by Father Kdmenski" This song had
